results.title: Day for night = La Nuit Americaine [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Carrosse, Productions et Editions Cinematographic Francaise, Produzione International Cinematografica, Marcel Berbert and Francois Truffaut
results.brief_description: Some critics saw Francois Truffaut’s loving homage to filmmaking as a lightweight addition to the canon of his more crucial work. Nevertheless, “Day for night” went on to win Best Foreign Language Film at the Academy Awards (1974) and is an enduring comedy about the vagaries of the movie business. Ferrand (played by Francois Truffaut) is a director working on his latest project, a melodrama called ‘Meet Pamela’, with an international cast. His leading man (Truffaut stalwart Jean-Pierre Leaud) is an insecure egoist conducting an obsessive affair with a free-spirited script-girl, given to irascible behaviour. The leading actress, recovering from a nervous breakdown, is American, and insecure about her talents. Additionally an aging actress, drinking heavily, continuously fluffs her lines, delaying a beleaguered production. Truffaut amuses by deftly expanding upon this set-up, exploring the difficulties of the filmmaking, including co-ordinating stunts, trying to induce animals to perform on cue, inconveniently pregnant cast members and nervous producers. Of greatest interest however is the behind-the-scenes romantic shenanigans that occur between the cast and crew, many of whom, despite the continuous frustrations, relay their love for the business of making movies. A light-hearted, whimsical and a wonderfully executed work. Cast includes Valentina Cortese, Alexandra Stewart, Jean-Pierre Aumont and Jean Champion.

results.title: Day care & the pre-school experience
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Overviews child care in modern industrialised societies and compares it to child care in hunter-gatherer and agricultural societies, emphasising the effect of child care on children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Day by day
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Griffith University and Robin James
results.brief_description: We look at some of the daily activities of the Chinese inhabitants of Beijing, beginning with Tai Chi exercises in the morning. Highlights work work, school, peasant farmers in a collective near Beijing, lunchtime, Children’s palaces where children may indulge in extra-curricular activities in sport and the arts, and Sunday visits to the park and the Forbidden City. Professor Colin Mackerras explains the history of calligraphy, and the ways in which the Chinese spend their time. Two dramatised segments show a grandfather sitting in the park and a family quarrel.

Professor Colin Mackerras explains the history of calligraphy, and the ways in which the Chinese spend their time. Two dramatised segments show a grandfather sitting in the park and a family quarrel.

results.title: Day at the Show
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: A visit to Melbourne’s Royal Show. Commentary designed for children showing the animals, pavilions, motor displays, show bags, fun fair and the grand parade ending with a fireworks display.

results.title: Day at night: I.M. Pei
results.brief_description: Interview with leading U.S. architect and designer, I.M. Pei. Covers his views on the Beaux Arts system under which he trained, his reasons for feeling that an elitist and exclusive view of architecture is no longer valid. He stresses the importance of urban housing in turning cities from places of commerce to areas offering their inhabitants a genuine richness of life

results.title: Day and night
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Franz Wells and Margaret Simpson
results.brief_description: An explanation of the occurrence of day and night by means of experiments with a rotating model globe. The film deals with the rotation of the earth on its tilted axis; the sun as a source of light to the earth; the cause of day and night; the movement of the earth, with its tilted axis, round the sun, and the effect of this tilting on the length of day and night in the four seasons of the year.

results.title: Day after day
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Fernand Dansereau, Victor Jobin, Hubert Aquin and Clement Perron
results.brief_description: A look at life in a small paper-milling town in Quebec where most of the 6,500 inhabitants derive their livelihood from the one industry. Day after day the same work, the same hours, the same machines, the same product, until the entire routine of living becomes but a reflection of the dominant routines of the mill. The commentary is made up largely of fragments of thoughts which might be running through the minds of the mill workers - this is the film’s theme as it probes to the very core of company-town life. (Awards: Toronto, San Francisco, Montreal, Chicago, New York)

results.title: Dax's Case
results.brief_description: This documentary raised vital questions about a patient’s right to choose whether to live or die, and about the role of the medical and legal profession. In 1973 Dax Cowart, a former air force pilot, was the victim of an explosion which left him blind, disfigured and suffering excruciating pain from severe burns. Despite persistent pleas to be allowed to die, Dax was kept alive. Now, leading a full life, he still maintains that he should have been allowed to die.

results.title: Dax
results.creator_credit: Mary Glasgow Audio-Visual and Antony Barrier
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of two teenage girls who arrive for a few days holiday at Dax, a thermal station in the Pyrenees Department of Lands. The narration and conversation are in simple, easy to understand French.
